NASA’s groundbreaking Ice Cloud and land Elevation Satellite 2 (ICESat-2) measures the Earth’s surface using lasers with amazing accuracy. The Advanced Topographic Laser Altimeter System (ATLAS) instrument pulses a green laser 10,000 times per second. With its telescope and array of single-photon counting detectors, ATLAS measures the precise travel time of photons from their release from the satellite until they return only about 3.3 milliseconds later.


This app will enable you to see where ICESat-2 will pass over an area on the Earth. Given a latitude, longitude and radius you can see the time and date of selected points along the satellite’s Reference Ground Track (RGT). You can also check from your current location or just drop a pin on the map.


 Please leave us feedback on the app store. We are excited about the ICESat-2 mission and want to share its results with the community. ICESat-2 Data Products are available to the public from the National Snow and Ice Data Center (NSIDC).
